usefulItems: aluminum foil, casserole dish (approx. 12 in. x 9½ in. x 2 in.), baking sheet, oven, stove top
title: Sweet Potato Stuffed Shells with Cauliflower Alfredo Sauce

ingredients.content: 12 oz cauliflower florets (approx. ½ med. head)
16 oz sweet potatoes, cut into 1 in. pieces

preparations.content: Prepare pasta on the stove top according to package instructions. Meanwhile make sauce.
Place onions, garlic and oil into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula and sauté <b>5 min/250°F/speed 1<b>.
Add cauliflower and chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Add water and stock paste and cook <b>13 min/212°F/speed 2<b>.
Drain cooked pasta shells through Varoma dish. To avoid clumping after cooking, spread shells out onto a baking sheet and set aside.
Add coconut cream, nutritional yeast, salt and pepper and increasing speed gradually purée <b>30 sec/speed 4<b>-9<b>. Pour into casserole dish and set aside.
Place onions and garlic into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.
Add sweet potatoes and chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>.
Add water and stock paste and cook <b>10 min/212°F/speed 1<b>.
Add ricotta, spinach and thyme and with aid of spatula mix <b>15 sec//speed 4<b>.
With a spoon, generously fill cooked pasta shells with sweet potato mixture. Arrange shells on top of sauce in casserole dish. Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes (350°F).
Remove foil and bake a further 10 minutes (350°F). Serve hot.

hintsAndTricks: Nutritional yeast is not to be confused with brewer's yeast or baking yeast. It is a natural flavor booster that lends a cheesy, nutty or savory flavor to many dishes. Available in the natural food section of your supermarket or in health food stores.
Serve cauliflower alfredo sauce with another pasta of choice, e.g. linguine and clams or penne with mushrooms.
